distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for udisks2 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2021-3802: Fixed insecure defaults in user-accessible mount helpers (bsc#1190606).
- Fixed vulnerability that allowed mounting ext4 devices over existing entries in fstab (bsc#1098797).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: A vulnerability found in udisks2. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted image file/USB leading to kernel panic. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: CVE description
